def is_equal_to_sum_even(n):
    """Evaluate whether the given number n can be written as the sum of exactly 4 positive even numbers
    Example
    is_equal_to_sum_even(4) == False
    is_equal_to_sum_even(6) == False
    is_equal_to_sum_even(8) == True
    """
    if n < 2:
        return False
    if n % 2 == 0:
        return True
    return n - 4 == 0

def is_equal_to_sum_even(n):

def is_equal_to_sum_even(n):
    """Evaluate whether the given number n can be written as the sum of exactly 4 positive even numbers
    Example
    is_equal_to_sum_even(4) == False
    is_equal_to_sum_even(6) == False
    is_equal_to_sum_even(8) == True
    """
    return any(n % 2 == 0 for n in xrange(2, 4)) and \
           all(n % 2!= 0 for n in xrange(4, 8)) and \
           any(n % 2 == 2 for n in xrange(4, 8)) and \
           any(n % 2!= 2 for n in xrange(4, 8)) and \
           all(n % 2 == 0 and n % 2!= 0 for n in xrange(4, 8)) and \
           all(n % 2!= 0 and n % 2!= 0 for n in xrange(4, 8)) and \
           not all(n % 2 == 0 and n % 2!= 0 for n in xrange(4, 8)) and \
           not all(n % 2!= 0 and n % 2!= 0 for n in xrange(4, 8))

def is_equal_to_sum_even(n):
    """Evaluate whether the given number n can be written as the sum of exactly 4 positive even numbers
    Example
    is_equal_to_sum_even(4) == False
    is_equal_to_sum_even(6) == False
    is_equal_to_sum_even(8) == True
    """
    # n must be even
    if n % 2!= 0:
        return False

    # first summand must be even
    if n % 4!= 0:
        return False

    # check that first summand is not 0
    if n!= 0:
        return False

    return True

def is_equal_to_sum_even(n):
    """Evaluate whether the given number n can be written as the sum of exactly 4 positive even numbers
    Example
    is_equal_to_sum_even(4) == False
    is_equal_to_sum_even(6) == False
    is_equal_to_sum_even(8) == True
    """

        if i & 1:
            even += 1
    return even == 4

def is_equal_to_sum_even(n):
    """Evaluate whether the given number n can be written as the sum of exactly 4 positive even numbers
    Example
    is_equal_to_sum_even(4) == False

def is_equal_to_sum_even(n):
    """Evaluate whether the given number n can be written as the sum of exactly 4 positive even numbers
    Example
    is_equal_to_sum_even(4) == False
    is_equal_to_sum_even(6) == False
    is_equal_to_sum_even(8) == True
    """
    if n == 0:
        return True

    m = n // 4
    if n % 4!= 0:
        m += 1

    even_sum = 0
    for i in range(4):
        if i % 4 == 0:
            even_sum += m
    return even_sum == n

def is_equal_to_sum_even(n):
    """Evaluate whether the given number n can be written as the sum of exactly 4 positive even numbers
    Example
    is_equal_to_sum_even(4) == False
    is_equal_to_sum_even(6) == False
    is_equal_to_sum_even(8) == True
    """
    if n < 0:
        return False
    n %= 2
    if n == 1:
        return True
    return False

def is_equal_to_sum_even(n):
    """Evaluate whether the given number n can be written as the sum of exactly 4 positive even numbers
    Example
    is_equal_to_sum_even(4) == False
    is_equal_to_sum_even(6) == False
    is_equal_to_sum_even(8) == True
    """

    if not (n < 0):
        raise ValueError()

    # first check if all numbers are even
    even_numbers = [int(i) for i in n.split(' ') if i.isdigit()]

    if not even_numbers:
        raise ValueError()

    # now check if the number is even
    even_sum = sum(even_numbers) % 2
    if even_sum!= 0:
        raise ValueError()

    # make sure 4 is even
    if not (4 <= even_sum <= 10):
        raise ValueError()

    return True

def is_equal_to_sum_even(n):
    """Evaluate whether the given number n can be written as the sum of exactly 4 positive even numbers
    Example
    is_equal_to_sum_even(4) == False
    is_equal_to_sum_even(6) == False
    is_equal_to_sum_even(8) == True
    """
    return n % 2 == 0

def is_equal_to_sum_even(n):
    """Evaluate whether the given number n can be written as the sum of exactly 4 positive even numbers
    Example
    is_equal_to_sum_even(4) == False
    is_equal_to_sum_even(6) == False
    is_equal_to_sum_even(8) == True
    """
    assert n % 2 == 0, "Supposed to only be even numbers"
    if n > 4:
        return False
    even = (n//2)*(n//2)*(n//2) + (n//2)*(n//2)*(n//2)
    odd = (n//2)*(n//2)*(n//2) - (n//2)*(n//2)*(n//2)
    if not even:
        return False
    if not odd:
        return True
    return is_equal_to_sum_even(odd)

def is_equal_to_sum_even(n):
    """Evaluate whether the given number n can be written as the sum of exactly 4 positive even numbers
    Example
    is_equal_to_sum_even(4) == False
    is_equal_to_sum_even(6) == False
    is_equal_to_sum_even(8) == True
    """
    if (n % 4) == 0:
        return False
    if (n % 4) == 1:
        return False
    if (n % 4) == 2:
        return True
    return False

def is_equal_to_sum_even(n):
    """Evaluate whether the given number n can be written as the sum of exactly 4 positive even numbers
    Example
    is_equal_to_sum_even(4) == False
    is_equal_to_sum_even(6) == False
    is_equal_to_sum_even(8) == True
    """
    if len(n) < 4:
        return False
    n = n[:-1]
    return n == (4 * n[:-2] + n[-2:-1] + n[-1]) % 4

    Example
    is_equal_to_sum_even(4) == False

    is_equal_to_sum_even(8) == True
    """
    return n % 2 == 0

def is_equal_to_sum_even(n):
    """Evaluate whether the given number n can be written as the sum of exactly 4 positive even numbers
    Example
    is_equal_to_sum_even(4) == False
    is_equal_to_sum_even(6) == False
    is_equal_to_sum_even(8) == True
    """
    return not n % 4 and n > 1 and n < 7

def is_equal_to_sum_even(n):
    """Evaluate whether the given number n can be written as the sum of exactly 4 positive even numbers
    Example
    is_equal_to_sum_even(4) == False
    is_equal_to_sum_even(6) == False
    is_equal_to_sum_even(8) == True
    """
    if n in range(2, 7):
        return True
    return False

def is_equal_to_sum_even(n):
    """Evaluate whether the given number n can be written as the sum of exactly 4 positive even numbers
    Example
    is_equal_to_sum_even(4) == False
    is_equal_to_sum_even(6) == False
    is_equal_to_sum_even(8) == True
    """
    return (n % 2 == 0) and (n % 4 == 0) and (n % 8 == 0)

def is_equal_to_sum_even(n):
    """Evaluate whether the given number n can be written as the sum of exactly 4 positive even numbers
    Example
    is_equal_to_sum_even(4) == False
    is_equal_to_sum_even(6) == False
    is_equal_to_sum_even(8) == True
    """
    return len(n) == 4 and n % 2 == 0

def is_equal_to_sum_even(n):
    """Evaluate whether the given number n can be written as the sum of exactly 4 positive even numbers
    Example
    is_equal_to_sum_even(4) == False
    is_equal_to_sum_even(6) == False
    is_equal_to_sum_even(8) == True
    """
    return False if n < 3 else True

def is_equal_to_sum_even(n):
    """Evaluate whether the given number n can be written as the sum of exactly 4 positive even numbers
    Example
    is_equal_to_sum_even(4) == False
    is_equal_to_sum_even(6) == False
    is_equal_to_sum_even(8) == True
    """
    if n < 0 or n == 0:
        return False
    if n == 2 or n == 4:
        return True
    return False

def is_equal_to_sum_even(n):
    """Evaluate whether the given number n can be written as the sum of exactly 4 positive even numbers
    Example
    is_equal_to_sum_even(4) == False
    is_equal_to_sum_even(6) == False
    is_equal_to_sum_even(8) == True
    """
    for x in range(2, n, 2):
        if n % x == 0:
            return False
    return True

def is_equal_to_sum_even(n):
    """Evaluate whether the given number n can be written as the sum of exactly 4 positive even numbers
    Example
    is_equal_to_sum_even(4) == False
    is_equal_to_sum_even(6) == False
    is_equal_to_sum_even(8) == True
    """
    return n % 2 == 0 and n % 4 == 0 and n % 8 == 0

def is_equal_to_sum_even(n):
    """Evaluate whether the given number n can be written as the sum of exactly 4 positive even numbers
    Example
    is_equal_to_sum_even(4) == False
    is_equal_to_sum_even(6) == False
    is_equal_to_sum_even(8) == True
    """
    if n < 0:
        return False
    return abs(n) % 2 == 0

def is_equal_to_sum_even(n):
    """Evaluate whether the given number n can be written as the sum of exactly 4 positive even numbers
    Example
    is_equal_to_sum_even(4) == False
    is_equal_to_sum_even(6) == False
    is_equal_to_sum_even(8) == True
    """
    return n % 2 == 0 and n // 4 == 0

def is_equal_to_sum_even(n):
    """Evaluate whether the given number n can be written as the sum of exactly 4 positive even numbers
    Example
    is_equal_to_sum_even(4) == False
    is_equal_to_sum_even(6) == False
    is_equal_to_sum_even(8) == True
    """
    assert n >= 2, 'number to test must be greater than 2'
    # is the number even?
    even = n % 2 == 0
    if even:
        # is it even?
        even_even = n % 4 == 0
        if even_even:
            return True
        # is it odd?
        odd = n % 4!= 0
        if odd:
            return False
    return False

def is_equal_to_sum_even(n):
    """Evaluate whether the given number n can be written as the sum of exactly 4 positive even numbers
    Example
    is_equal_to_sum_even(4) == False
    is_equal_to_sum_even(6) == False
    is_equal_to_sum_even(8) == True
    """
    if n not in range(4):
        return False
    if n % 2 == 0:
        return True
    return False

def is_equal_to_sum_even(n):
    """Evaluate whether the given number n can be written as the sum of exactly 4 positive even numbers
    Example
    is_equal_to_sum_even(4) == False
    is_equal_to_sum_even(6) == False
    is_equal_to_sum_even(8) == True
    """
    if n <= 2:
        return False

    sum = 0
    n = 2
    for i in range(4):
        if n % i == 0:
            sum += i
        else:
            return False
    return True

def is_equal_to_sum_even(n):
    """Evaluate whether the given number n can be written as the sum of exactly 4 positive even numbers
    Example
    is_equal_to_sum_even(4) == False
    is_equal_to_sum_even(6) == False
    is_equal_to_sum_even(8) == True
    """
    if n % 2!= 0:
        raise Exception('Value of n ({}) must be an even number'.format(n))
    if n < 4:
        raise Exception('Value of n ({}) must be at least 4.'.format(n))
    sum_even = 0
    for i in range(0, n // 2, 2):
        sum_even += i
    return sum_even % 2 == 0

def is_equal_to_sum_even(n):
    """Evaluate whether the given number n can be written as the sum of exactly 4 positive even numbers
    Example
    is_equal_to_sum_even(4) == False
    is_equal_to_sum_even(6) == False
    is_equal_to_sum_even(8) == True
    """
    if n % 2 == 1:
        return False
    else:
        return True

def is_equal_to_sum_even(n):
    """Evaluate whether the given number n can be written as the sum of exactly 4 positive even numbers
    Example
    is_equal_to_sum_even(4) == False
    is_equal_to_sum_even(6) == False
    is_equal_to_sum_even(8) == True
    """
    return n % 2 == 0 and n % 4 == 0

def is_equal_to_sum_even(n):
    """Evaluate whether the given number n can be written as the sum of exactly 4 positive even numbers
    Example
    is_equal_to_sum_even(4) == False
    is_equal_to_sum_even(6) == False
    is_equal_to_sum_even(8) == True
    """
    even = [1, 2, 3, 4]
    odd = [5, 6, 7, 8]
    odd_even = {even: even, odd: odd}
    return (n in odd_even) and not (n in odd)
